other_tests.findings: Both testes had normal echotexture and normal Doppler flow, with no focal lesions. Bilateral subcentimeter epididymal cysts were identified.

Nodular opacity at the apex of the right lung, which had not changed from previous studies, likely related to previous granulomatous disease. New ill-defined opacities at the lung bases could reflect multifocal pneumonia.
New engorgement of testicular vessels, greater on the left side than the right side. Both testes showed heterogeneous echotexture, suggestive of epididymo-orchitis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Findings changed from the first ultrasound to indicate new engorgement.

other_tests.findings: Dense inflammatory infiltrate in the adventitia of the arterial wall and disruption of elastic fibers in the vascular intima.
Prominent inflammation surrounding small arteries and full-thickness necrotizing vasculitis in the epididymis.
Necrotizing vasculitis of small-to-medium arteries of the testis.
Results of cerebrospinal fluid analysis were normal.
